N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 219-3.6 - Operating requirements

State Regulations
(a) No person
may cause or allow emissions to the outdoor atmosphere having a six-minute
average opacity of 10 percent or greater from any emission source subject to
these requirements. (b) No person
may cause or allow emissions of carbon monoxide to the outdoor atmosphere
having an hourly average concentration in the flue gas exceeding 150 parts per
million by volume, dry basis, corrected to seven percent oxygen. (c) No person may operate a facility subject
to this Subpart unless the temperatures described in section
219-3.5
of this Subpart are
maintained at all times that waste is being burned. (d) The commissioner must be notified in
writing at least 10 days prior to the commencement of operation of a new or
modified incinerator subject to this Subpart. Notes
